message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.SY. 

The paper focuses on designing an adaptive carrier sense multiple access scheme for efficient and reliable data transfer across multiple wireless body area networks (BANs) in a tiered architecture. This involves investigating the proposed scheme using two distributed cross-layer optimized dynamic routing techniques, which suggests a focus on networking and information theory (cs.NI, cs.IT). The paper also discusses an open-access experimental dataset of 'everyday' mixed-activities, which suggests a focus on machine learning and computer vision (cs.LG, cs.MM). Finally, the paper proposes an adaptive cross-layer carrier sensing mechanism between the physical and MAC layer, which adjusts the carrier sense threshold based on the slowly-varying channel condition, indicating a focus on systems and control (cs.SY).
